vehicle

Class UseVehicle

  • java.lang.Object
    • vehicle.UseVehicle

  • public class UseVehicle
extends java.lang.Object
    UseVehicle is a main class used to demonstrate inheritance among super class Vehicle, and its subclasses Car and MotorCycle.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Philip Bryan Datoon

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UseVehicle() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void checkValidity(int value)
      Gets an integer value, then checks its validity through the program.
      static int getMiles()
      Gets and reads the value of average miles per gallon from user input.
      static int getWheels()
      Gets and reads the value of number of wheels from user input.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main function gets input from the user by calling getWheels() and getMiles() for vehicle's number of wheels and average miles, respectively.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • UseVehicle

        public UseVehicle()

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Main function gets input from the user by calling getWheels() and getMiles() for vehicle's number of wheels and average miles, respectively. It involves creation and instantiation of Vehicle, Car and MotorCycle objects, and input display.
        Parameters:
        args - Java command-line arguments
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        Since:
        1.0

      • getWheels

        public static int getWheels()
        Gets and reads the value of number of wheels from user input.
        Returns:
        The number of wheels input is returned if user entered valid data. Otherwise, it will return to ask user to enter valid number of wheels input again.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getMiles

        public static int getMiles()
        Gets and reads the value of average miles per gallon from user input.
        Returns:
        The average miles per gallon input is returned if user entered valid data. Otherwise, it will return to ask user to enter valid average miles per gallon input again.

      • checkValidity

        public static void checkValidity(int value)
        Gets an integer value, then checks its validity through the program. If either conditions, value is equal to or less than zero, InputMismatchException is being thrown with given String message passed to its class.
        Parameters:
        value - An integer value
